pitt.search.semanticvectors.vectors
Enum ComplexVector.Mode

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Enum<ComplexVector.Mode>
      pitt.search.semanticvectors.vectors.ComplexVector.Mode
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<ComplexVector.Mode>
Enclosing class:
ComplexVector
public static enum ComplexVector.Mode
extends java.lang.Enum<ComplexVector.Mode>

We use the 'MODE' enumeration to keep track of which mode the complex vector is in. By 'MODE' we mean whether the vector is using POLAR_SPARSE, POLAR_DENSE or CARTESIAN coordinates. CARTESIAN uses two 32 bit floats for each element, one for the real coordinate and one for the imaginary.

Enum Constant Summary
CARTESIAN
          Uses a pair of 32 bit floats for each (real, imaginary) complex coordinate.
POLAR_DENSE
          Uses a nonnegative 16 bit short for each phase angle.
POLAR_SPARSE
          Uses a pair of 16 bit shorts for each (offset, phase angle) pair.

Enum Constant Detail

POLAR_DENSE

public static final ComplexVector.Mode POLAR_DENSE
Uses a nonnegative 16 bit short for each phase angle. The value -1 is reserved for representing the complex number zero, i.e., there is no entry in this dimension.

POLAR_SPARSE

public static final ComplexVector.Mode POLAR_SPARSE
Uses a pair of 16 bit shorts for each (offset, phase angle) pair.

CARTESIAN

public static final ComplexVector.Mode CARTESIAN
Uses a pair of 32 bit floats for each (real, imaginary) complex coordinate.
